Lovely to have a new task of being a reliable local point of contact to those who wish to come to Vietnam and Indochina to make businesses Many of my Singaporean partners and friends have frequently sent my contact to new comers who have been assigned to travel to Vietnam to explore new business opportunities. As "think globally, act locally" advices, knowing and understanding local culture is a must to those who would like to go beyond their traditional territories to carry out their new assignments. It is true that different country has different culture where its population's thought, acts and decision-making process are not the same. Even in the same country, different region's inhabitants are not thinking and doing the same. So reading, learning, proactive interactions and keen observations in everywhere we travel would help bridge the culture gaps and enhance our understanding of different cultures across the globe.

Those key elements that truly reflect our purpose, commitment to quality and simplicity, and connect us with our customers - that is ultimately what keeps our team dedicated and our clients loyal. I was fortunate enough to celebrate New Year in Singapore â€“ what an incredible place. My daughter had previously worked there and returning for New Year together, was a post COVID plan which we were finally able to achieve. We enjoyed many aspects of an engaging nation, with ease of access to transport, walking routes and a real sense of East meets West in a blend of culture and history. Visiting the National Gallery was a highlight. I am not usually an â€˜art personâ€™ â€“ I know what I like, but the Liu Kuo-Sung exhibition on Experimentation as Method, triggered hugely positive engagement and discussion in relation to challenge and the critical role that innovation contributes. His narrative was fascinating and I could not help but draw parallels in achieving excellence in HRâ€™s role to encourage interaction, supporting mutual growth and maturity; naturally restraining each other as a new vitality is created through collaboration. Over a 70 year+ career, Liu Kuo-Sung has said that he continues to progress his thinking and now feels that art or culture, should be borderless and global, not nationalist. He was asked the question: where do you find inspiration to express yourself? â€¦.a great question. A very thought provoking visit. #singapore #nationalgallerysingapore #liukuosung #experimentationasmethod #reinvention #perspectives
